articles.title: Keep chips, French fries & ice-cream at bay: Having ultra-processed food in diet can up depression risk, s - Economic Times
articles.description: Eating over 30% ultra-processed food every day increases the risk of depression, according to research from Deakin University and Cancer Council Victoria. The study, carried out on over 23,000 Australians, noted the link though researchers did not conclude th…
articles.content: NEW DELHI: Daily diet that includes over 30 per cent ultra-processed food is associated with a significant risk of depression, according to a study. Ultra-processed foods are not limited to typical j… [+2401 chars]
